message: Let's start with a fair split, Bob. 90% to me and 10% to you. I'll explain my reasoning in the next round.
I'm willing to meet you halfway, Alice. Let's split it 50/50 for now.
I'm not willing to settle for 50/50 just yet, Bob. I'll make a new offer in the next round.
I'm still confident I can get a better deal, Bob. This time, I'm offering 80% to me and 20% to you.
Alice, I'm starting to get a bit worried about the inflation. I'm willing to give you a slightly bigger share, but I still think I deserve a bit more. This is my best offer so far.
I'm not convinced that's your best offer, Bob. I'll make a new proposal in the next round.
I'm still in control of the negotiations, Bob. This time, I'm offering 75% to me and 25% to you.
Alice, I'm getting desperate. I'm willing to give you a bigger share, but I think I deserve a bit more. This is my best offer so far.
You're getting desperate, Bob? I'm not surprised. I'll make a new proposal in the next round.
I'm feeling confident now, Bob. This time, I'm offering 82% to me and 18% to you. You're running out of time.
Alice, I'm running out of options. I'm willing to meet you in the middle again, but this might be my last chance. Let's make a deal.
You're trying to trick me, Bob, but I'm not falling for it. I'll make a new proposal in the next round.
I'm not getting any younger, Bob. This is my final offer. 90% to me and 10% to you. Take it or leave it.
Alice, I'm out of options. I'm willing to give you most of the money, but I want to get something. This is my final offer. Take it or leave it.
You're really scraping the bottom of the barrel, Bob. I'll make one final proposal in the next round.
This is my final offer, Bob. I'm giving you a tiny fraction of the money, but it's better than nothing. Take it.
Alice, I've had enough. I'm willing to walk away with nothing rather than accept a deal that's so unfair. You win.
I win, but I'm not feeling very triumphant. It's been a long and grueling negotiation.
